intro: Pyxidaria soriana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pyxidaria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Pyxidaria soriana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
